definition: front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: What year was it destroyed on Halloween?
sentences.chinese: 它是哪一年的万圣节前夜被毁掉的？

sentences.english: Don't cram the night before the exam.
sentences.chinese: 不要在考试前夜填鸭式恶补。

sentences.english: The twenty-two twins twisted wrists twice on the Christmas Eve.
sentences.chinese: 二十二个孪生子在圣诞前夜拧了两次手腕。

sentences.english: New Year's Eve Wishing Wall in New York.
sentences.chinese: 新年前夜纽约许愿墙五彩纷呈。

sentences.english: It was the first night of Chanukah and the night before Ellie's last final.
sentences.chinese: 那是光明节的第一个晚上，也是艾莉期末考试的前夜。

sentences.english: On Christmas Eve I hung up my stocking along with my sisters.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节前夜，我跟姐姐们一起把长袜挂了起来。

sentences.english: Young kids often dress up and have fun at Halloween.
sentences.chinese: 万圣节前夜，小孩子通常都乔装打扮，玩得很开心。

sentences.english: Love is spending a few minutes together at midnight before Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 爱是在圣诞前夜的子夜一起度过的美好时光。

sentences.english: There was a non-stop TV programmer all the night on the eve of Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞前夜有一场通宵连续播放的电视节目。

sentences.english: One night I had a nightmare, running whole night for unobtainable thing. I made a decision when I was awoken.
sentences.chinese: 前夜作了一个奔波生计的梦，醒来后暗暗地决定。

sentences.english: English children always hang a stocking at the end of the bed on Christmas Eve.
sentences.chinese: 在圣诞前夜，孩子们总是把一只袜子挂在床脚。

sentences.english: On the eve of Lantern Festival, all the lanter are hung up.
sentences.chinese: 在元宵节前夜，所有的灯笼都被挂起来。

sentences.english: No word on how the first famliy plans to spent New Year’s Eve tonight.
sentences.chinese: 没人知道第一家庭今晚计划如何欢度新年前夜。

sentences.english: Prepareing for the Chirstmas Eve feast makes me at my wit's end.
sentences.chinese: 准备圣诞前夜宴会使我伤透脑筋。

sentences.english: The China market was still in its pre-opening and reform stage.
sentences.chinese: 那时候，中国还处于改革开放的前夜。

definition: to be about to arrive/to be around the corner
to just happen to coincide with
time/period during the day/one of the 12 two-hour periods enumerated by the earthly branches 地支
